intro: Commelina clavatoides, commonly known as the slender spiderwort, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes plants known for their striking floral structures. The plant features slender, upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have three petals with a distinctive blue or violet color. Commelina clavatoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
